meta.description: Generic event cards - shuffled deck, one revealed per era. Events are archetypes with real historical examples.

events.name: Ice Age
events.description: Global cooling causes glaciation. Sea levels drop dramatically, habitats shrink.
events.science: Ice ages occur when orbital cycles (Milankovitch) reduce solar heating. Glaciers lock up water, dropping sea levels 50-100m.

events.name: Volcanic Winter
events.description: Massive volcanic eruptions block sunlight. Global temperatures plummet.
events.science: Large Igneous Provinces (LIPs) release sulfur aerosols blocking sunlight, plus CO2 causing long-term warming after initial cooling.
real_examples: Siberian Traps (~252 MYA) - The Great Dying, 96% species lost
Deccan Traps (~66 MYA) - Contributed to K-Pg extinction

events.name: Asteroid Impact
events.description: Bolide strike causes impact winter. Debris blocks sunlight for years.
events.science: Impacts >10km diameter cause global catastrophe. Ejecta reenters atmosphere, igniting forests. Dust blocks photosynthesis.
real_examples: Chicxulub (~66 MYA) - K-Pg extinction, end of dinosaurs
Late Heavy Bombardment (~4 BYA) - Sterilized early Earth

events.name: Ocean Anoxia
events.description: Ocean oxygen levels crash. Hydrogen sulfide builds up, poisoning marine life.
events.science: Anoxic events occur when ocean circulation stalls. Bacteria produce toxic H2S. Purple/green sulfur bacteria dominate.

events.name: Global Warming
events.description: Runaway greenhouse effect. Oceans acidify, heat stress kills.
events.science: CO2 and methane trap heat. Ocean pH drops (acidification), dissolving shells. Thermal stress exceeds organism tolerance.

events.name: Sea Level Collapse
events.description: Rapid marine regression exposes continental shelves. Coastal habitats destroyed.
events.science: Sea level drops when water locks in glaciers or tectonic changes alter ocean basin volume. Epicontinental seas drain.
real_examples: End-Permian (~252 MYA) - Pangaea assembly drained seas

events.name: Reef Collapse
events.description: Coral reef ecosystems fail. Carbonate production crashes, biodiversity hotspots lost.
events.science: Reefs are sensitive to temperature, pH, and sediment. Reef gaps in fossil record last 5-10 million years after collapse.
real_examples: Late Devonian (~372 MYA) - Reef gap of 100 MY

events.name: Oxygen Surge
events.description: Atmospheric oxygen rises dramatically. Larger body sizes become possible.
events.effect: All players gain +2 alleles. [Insect] and [Amphibian] may place +2 markers.
events.science: Oxygen levels control maximum body size, especially for organisms using tracheal breathing. Higher O2 = bigger insects.

events.name: New Frontier
events.description: A new habitat type becomes available for colonization.
events.effect: Add 2 new tiles of player's choice. First to claim gets +3 alleles.
events.science: Ecological opportunity drives adaptive radiation. Empty niches reward early colonizers with reduced competition.
real_examples: Land colonization (~470 MYA) - Plants, then arthropods

events.name: Adaptive Radiation
events.description: Vacant ecological niches allow rapid diversification.
events.effect: All players may evolve one trait at half cost (round down).
events.science: After extinctions, survivors radiate into empty niches. Example: mammals after dinosaurs evolved from shrew to whale size in 20 MY.
real_examples: Cambrian Explosion (~540 MYA) - Body plan diversity

events.name: Ozone Shield
events.description: UV protection strengthens. Land becomes safer for colonization.
events.effect: Players with [Terrestrial] traits gain +2 alleles. Land tiles give +1 marker.
events.science: Ozone (O3) absorbs UV-C radiation. Without it, DNA damage prevents land colonization. Photosynthesis created the ozone layer.

events.name: Predator Decline
events.description: Top predators reduced in number. Prey populations boom.
events.effect: Players without [Predator] tag gain +3 alleles and +1 marker.
events.science: Trophic cascades occur when apex predators decline. Mesopredator release and prey population explosions follow.
real_examples: Post-K-Pg (~65 MYA) - No large predators for 10 MY

events.name: Mutualism Boom
events.description: Symbiotic relationships flourish. Cooperation provides advantages.
events.effect: Players with [Pollinator] or [Social] tags gain +4 alleles.
events.science: Coevolution between species creates mutual benefits. Pollination, gut microbiomes, and cleaning symbioses enhance fitness.

events.name: Continental Drift
events.description: Landmasses shift position. Populations become isolated or connected.
events.effect: Shuffle 3 random tiles and replace. Players may move 2 markers for free.
events.science: Continental drift at ~2-10 cm/year creates and destroys habitats over millions of years. Isolation drives speciation.
real_examples: Pangaea breakup (~200 MYA) - Created Atlantic Ocean

events.name: Climate Shift
events.description: Global temperature and precipitation patterns change significantly.
events.effect: Flip 2 tiles to new biome types. Affected players may relocate markers.
events.science: Climate shifts driven by orbital cycles, tectonics, and ocean currents redistribute habitats across latitudes.

events.name: Biome Transition
events.description: One ecosystem type gradually replaces another across large areas.
events.effect: Convert 2 Forest tiles to Grassland OR vice versa. Matching traits gain +2.
events.science: Biome shifts occur when climate changes or new dominant species evolve. Grasslands replaced forests as CO2 dropped.

events.name: Arms Race
events.description: Predator-prey competition intensifies. Evolutionary pressure increases.
events.effect: All [Predator] and [Armored] traits cost -1 allele this era.
events.science: Red Queen hypothesis: species must constantly evolve to maintain relative fitness. Predators drive prey defenses and vice versa.
real_examples: Cambrian arms race - Shells vs jaws

events.name: Niche Partitioning
events.description: Resources divided among competitors. Specialization rewarded.
events.effect: Players with 3+ unique tags gain +2 alleles. Generalists gain +1.
events.science: Competitive exclusion principle: species partition resources to coexist. Time, space, and diet differentiation reduces overlap.
